body.description: Medline Baby soft Dry Cleansing Cloths make cleansing sensitive, fragile skin easier than ever. Regular tissues can fall apart and reusable washcloths may be too rough. Baby soft wipes are the durable, ultra soft and gentle alternative- the same disposable cloths hospitals use.

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #7,038 in Baby (See Top 100 in Baby) #77 in Disposable Diapers

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Medline Ultrasoft Dry Cleansing Cloths make it easy to get baby clean. Cleansing delicate skin requires the mildest, gentlest care possible to avoid skin irritation. That's why our dry cleansing cloths-with Soft Spun fabric and zero additives-are the wipes Moms prefer.

Fragrance-free cloths gently cleanse skin. Just Add Water Add water or own solution, cleanse, and toss. No Additives Perfect for baby's sensitive skin. Gentle on Skin Softer than reusable cloths. Do Not Flush Simply toss them in the trash.
One soft cloth meets your baby's cleansing needs at home and on-the-go.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better alternative to traditional baby wipes
reviews.reviewText: Bought these originally with the intention of using them with a diaper balm for my daughter, but my daughter is allergic to the diaper balm for now. She came home with a mild rash which was totally normal and expected and the pediatrician advised against regular baby wipes, suggesting I use washcloths in the meantime until her skin healed. I brought these into her next appointment and these received the pediatrician's approval. Her rash is clearing up as her skin isn't nearly as irritated when I use these dampened with water versus a regular wipe, they're larger, and they're softer. Just did a subscribe and save for these wipes as I use fewer of these wipes per nappy change and they're a better quality product than regular baby wipes. Wish I could buy them in cases of 1000 or more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect in every way!
reviews.reviewText: For years I have been searching for the ideal disposable washcloth. I have tried all of the well-known brands, and a number of others, but none of them met my expectations. For a while I gave up searching, but then last week decided to look again because I really want to be able to throw a washcloth away instead of having to wash and dry it; and, most of all, because I consider that a single-use washcloth surpasses all others in terms of health considerations. I looked at a number of brands on amazon, and finally decided to try Medline Babysoft Sensitive. As soon as I touched the first washcloth to my face, I knew that I had found the product I had long been seeking. It is soft, yet strong, and works equally well moist or dry. I have just ordered more and intend to use them daily from now on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2020
reviews.reviewText: I had never heard of dry wipes before, so full disclosure I've yet to try other brands, but these ones are great! I'm expecting a baby in a little more than a month, so I wanted to try these out on myself before using them later and not liking them. They are super thick and fairly big, so much so that I cut them in half and that does the trick for me. I simply wet them with water and wipe solution and so far so good.I have also used them to clean up messes, and they are much better than paper towels as they can be rinsed and reused. Pretty handy overall, I already have a larger amount of the way!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A family member discharged from the hospital recently needed dry wipes for sensitive areas when going to the bathroom. Medline is the brand used by the hospital and these wipes that I ordered are close to the product hospital staff used. But I believe they used the Medline "ultra" soft dry wipes. Regardless, these wipes do their job in helping clean sensitive areas without any irritation or debris left behind. You can use the wipes with a foam cleanser, like the one typically used by hospitals for cleaning different parts of the body as well. Keep in mind that the wipes are intended for single use, just as hospitals use them. I think I read a review where someone is rinsing them out, drying them and reusing (perhaps using only for wiping or cleaning skin.) I'm certain that reusing this product to cleanse with would not be sanitary. What is important about these wipes is that they will not fall apart during use, it is a durable material unlike strictly paper products that tear and can disintegrate. The smooth texture will ensure there won't be discomfort using them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Silky Cloth With Many Uses💕
reviews.reviewText: I purchased to remove makeup. I was very impressed. I’ve tried various other products like disposable cotton rounds, terrycloth rounds, but felt both were too small. My skin is super sensitive and I’ve ruin many facial cloths over the years. The Medline baby wipes are perfect. They are so large in fact, I cut them in half. I can use them for eye remover on one side and facial remover on the other side. You can actually see the cloth come cleaner under water to wash your face again. This doesn’t happen with a washcloth. As a full-time caregiver I also see other uses as a regular washcloth; a cloth to take in our purse when you might need a little refresher on the go and of course, as intended the perfect baby wipe for the tender bottom.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for sensitive skin and diaper rash
reviews.reviewText: My granddaughter had awful diaper rash at 3 weeks old. We searched for these, and they were perfect. My daughter cut each one into 4, which made them the size of baby wipes. At changing time we would dip in water, and use to wipe the irritated area. We will definitely keep a supply of these in the house.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars These are the ones! Great Baby Wipe Alternative!
reviews.reviewText: I have been trying to find a hospital style dry wipe to use for the first few weeks after bringing baby home. After ordering and trying 3 other brands, we went with these. They are very soft and larger in size so I can fold it in half and get the thickness I want. They hold up well when wet and are even the softest of all of them dry. Great wipe. Exactly what I was looking for so we went back and ordered the box of 500!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars No absorption and tiny
reviews.reviewText: Bought these as disposable burp clothes for a very long road trip. They did not hold up. Surface area is tiny and they never absorbed the spit up. It would run right off. Stopped using them. They’re soft to the touch though.
